{"step_by_step_thinking": "The paranasal sinuses are air-filled extensions of the respiratory part of the nasal cavity. There are four paired sinuses, named according to the bone in which they are located; maxillary, frontal, sphenoid and ethmoid. The development of the paranasal sinuses begins in the fetal period and continues after birth. The first paranasal sinus to develop in utero is the maxillary sinus, followed by the ethmoid, frontal, and sphenoid sinuses.", "answer_choice": "A. Maxillary"}
